body:
So, since the ama's are now on high demand again, I made one, again. But, with a little twist! <3

You can ask me anything about building and I will try my best to explain that building aspect you have in mind. From the silliest questions to the hardest ones! Don't be shy :D

For reference, I guess, here are some of my builds and a link to my personal imgur:
http://awarriorvenom.imgur.com/all/

title: AMA: Building Oriented

replies.body: How did you become such a great builder?
replies.body_tagged: How did you become such a great builder?

replies.body:
Can you teach me how to build a bridge, please? Or at least help me? x3
Medium.
replies.body_tagged:

Medium.

replies.body:
You know it bebe :)

Little twist though!
replies.body_tagged:
You know it bebe :)

Little twist though!

replies.body:
I was always an artistic person, in anything, I draw a lot (Patterns, Builds, Schematics)

So after a lot of practising and tips from other great builders, I developed my own style.

I bought Minecraft when it was 1.3.2 so 3 years ago? But I began building seriously around 1 and half years ago.

At the beginning, I copied shapes and designs form other builders, and then, made my own shapes using bits and pieces from builds I found here and there.

After a lot of time, I could make my own stuff :)

World Edit played an huge role in that aswell!

If you know how to //copy, //flip, //rotate you are off the a amazing start :D (Because you can play around with build more without wasting much time, thus, developing your creative mind faster)

If could go more in depth about building if you ask me, but I think this will do haha

(EDIT: I might add more text from time to time)

replies.body:
- World Edit (Liteloader SP 1.7.10 by Mumfrey)
- MCEdit (For flipping and pasting massive structures)
- World Painter (With custom brushes to make terrain quickly)
- Voxel Sniper (Im learning :P)
- My Creative Mind
replies.body_tagged:
- World Edit (Liteloader SP 1.7.10 by Mumfrey)
- MCEdit (For flipping and pasting massive structures)
- World Painter (With custom brushes to make terrain quickly)
- Voxel Sniper (Im learning :P)
- My Creative Mind

replies.body: About how long does it take you to build a map for Nexus? Nebula?
replies.body_tagged: About how long does it take you to build a map for Nexus? Nebula?

replies.body:
Nebula: 40 hours (Mostly due to YAML, Fun Fact: I only made Sandstorm)
Nexus: 4 to 10 hours (Depending on size)
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
How good are you at doing modern builds/architecture? I've done a few in the past but sadly I gave up building because the server that I built on went down :l

Also, what's your favorite block/block combination to build with and why?
replies.body_tagged:
How good are you at doing modern builds/architecture? I've done a few in the past but sadly I gave up building because the server that I built on went down :l

Also, what's your favorite block/block combination to build with and why?

replies.body:
I never actually gave modern builds a go, because I prefer fantasy and being able to do anything. (Shape, form)

Definitely Sandstorm's block combination, I did a lot of builds using this block combo, and compared to a lot of other builds, they all came out great!


Stonebrick, Stonebrick Slab, Stonebrick Stair
Sandstone, Sandstone Slab, Sandstone Stair
Wool (35:8), Wool (35:0), Glowstone
replies.body_tagged:
I never actually gave modern builds a go, because I prefer fantasy and being able to do anything. (Shape, form)

Definitely Sandstorm's block combination, I did a lot of builds using this block combo, and compared to a lot of other builds, they all came out great!


Stonebrick, Stonebrick Slab, Stonebrick Stair
Sandstone, Sandstone Slab, Sandstone Stair
Wool (35:8), Wool (35:0), Glowstone
